alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:41AM EDT until July 12 at 9:41AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. For the Lamoille River...including Jeffersonville...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 447.0 feet, The Lamoille River will begin to leave its banks around Jeffersonville and downstream through Cambridge Village. Persons with interests in the floodplain, such as farmers, campers and seasonal canoe and kayak operators should move their equipment to higher ground. At 450.0 feet, Water will rise to near the edge of Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 451.0 feet, Water will cover Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. Traffic diversions may be necessary, and motorists planning to travel route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 451.5 feet, Route 15 in Cambridge becomes impassable. Traffic diversions will be required, and motorists planning to travel Route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 453.0 feet, Water will begin to enter streets in Jeffersonville. The north end of Main Street will flood first, and low lying homes will be afected. Portions of Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will begin to flood, and there will be widespread field flooding along the river. At 453.5 feet, In Jeffersonville, Main Street, Depot Street, and Maple Street will begin to flood. Businesses along Route 15 in Jeffersonville will flood. Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will be inundated and impassable in some areas. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 455.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 447.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EDT Tuesday was 455.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 455.7 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 454.5 feet on 11/01/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 830 PM EDT.
